Violation_Type: Failure to consider psychological evidence in credibility assessment
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in failing to consider the impact of Dr. Devins' psychological report on the applicant's credibility
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed refugee status based on fear of persecution in Turkey due to ethnicity, religion, and political opinion
Decision_Outcome: Board questioned applicant's credibility but accepted diagnosis of chronic posttraumatic stress disorder
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: Allowed judicial review and referred the case back to a different panel of the Board for redetermination
Defendant_Behavior: Board dismissed relevance of psychological report without meaningful discussion
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on ethnicity, religion, and political opinion
Assessment_Factor: Impact of chronic PTSD on credibility
Applicable_Legislation: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of IRPA
Credibility_Assessment: Board failed to adequately analyze how medical condition affected credibility
Evidence_Used: Dr. Devins' psychological report diagnosing chronic posttraumatic stress disorder
Application_Basis: Refugee protection under IRPA based on well-founded fear of persecution
Evidence_Assessed: Psychological report linking trauma to applicant's testimony
Relief_Sought: Redetermination of refugee status by a new Board panel
Governing_Rule: Credibility findings must meaningfully address relevant medical evidence
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of analysis regarding the effect of PTSD on credibility
Outcome: Judicial review allowed; case remitted for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in Turkey due to protected grounds
Cause_Description: Applicant fears persecution in Turkey due to ethnicity, religion, and political opinion
Evidence_Handling: Board acknowledged diagnosis but failed to assess its implications for credibility
Legal_Provision_Violated: Principles of procedural fairness and proper credibility assessment under IRPA
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient consideration of expert psychological evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Psychological evidence not properly integrated into credibility analysis
Decision_Rationale: Decision is patently unreasonable due to failure to address material evidence affecting credibility
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to meaningfully discuss the impact of PTSD on testimony reliability
Legal_Standard_Applied: Patent unreasonableness standard on judicial review
